Direct election of the executive by the public
Executive serves independently of the legislature
questions.answer: Separation of head of state and head of government

questions.question: The concept of 'checks and balances' was first elaborated by which political philosopher?
Which international body has the power to impose sanctions on member states?
In constitutional law, what does the term 'strict scrutiny' refer to?
options: The highest standard of judicial review applied to laws affecting fundamental rights
A legislative process for passing laws quickly
An informal review by the executive
A review standard for economic regulations
questions.answer: The highest standard of judicial review applied to laws affecting fundamental rights

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of the Federalist Papers?
options: To support the ratification of the U.S. Constitution
To oppose the Bill of Rights
To explain the Declaration of Independence
To support the Articles of Confederation
questions.answer: To support the ratification of the U.S. Constitution

questions.question: What is the principle behind 'dual federalism'?
options: National government has supremacy over states
National and state governments operate independently in separate spheres
States have no power under the federal government
Power is centralized in the federal government
questions.answer: National and state governments operate independently in separate spheres

questions.question: Which amendment to the U.S. Constitution abolished slavery?
What is the primary role of the International Court of Justice?
options: To prosecute individuals for crimes against humanity
To settle legal disputes between states
To regulate the United Nations budget
questions.answer: To settle legal disputes between states

questions.question: What does 'habeas corpus' protect against?
Which principle limits the powers of government by dividing authority among different branches?
Which document first limited the power of the English monarchy and laid the foundation for constitutional government?
What does the term 'gerrymandering' mean?
options: Redrawing electoral district boundaries to favor one party
The separation of powers among branches
questions.answer: Redrawing electoral district boundaries to favor one party

questions.question: Which political philosopher argued that life without government would be 'solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short'?
What is the main function of the European Parliament?
options: To legislate and represent EU citizens
questions.answer: To legislate and represent EU citizens

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a non-governmental organization (NGO)?
What does the term 'sovereignty' mean in political science?
options: The ability of a state to govern itself without external interference
The right of citizens to vote
The division of power between branches of government
questions.answer: The ability of a state to govern itself without external interference
